An Introduction to R programming Chapter 1 Getting Started 1.1 Using R as a calculator 1.2 Variables in R

An Introduction to R programming Nicholas Henderson 2022-06-14 Chapter 1 Getting Started 1.1 Using R as a calculator You can use R as a basic calculator. For example: 42 + 17 ## [1] 59 sqrt(243) ## [1] 15.58846 1.56*1233 ## [1] 1923.48 7.21*8^4 ## [1] 29532.16 For more complicated mathematical operations, it is useful to store intermediate values in named variables. x <- (42 + 17)*sqrt(43) y <- 7.21*8^4 + log(2.34) z <- x/y z ## print out the value of z ## [1] 0.01310022 Here, x, y, and z are examples of variables. The pair of characters <- used together is known as the assignment operator in R. x <- 2 assigns the value 2 to the variable x. 1.2 Variables in R
